Switch clarity ON OFF Privacy policy close Study Research Explore Connect School of Computing Science Our staffDr Richard MccreadieMr Ethan KellyZhen Tian Dr Richard McCreadie Senior Lecturer (Computing Science) telephone: 4932 email: Richard.Mccreadie@glasgow.ac.uk Room 304, Computing Science, Sir Alwyn Williams Building Import to contacts https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2751-2087 Biography I am a Lecturer in Information Retrieval and Data Systems at the University of Glasgow, UK. My core research topics include real-time information retrieval, machine learning, big data stream processing and evaluation methodologies over streaming data. In particular, I specialize in real-time IR technologies to enable users to efficiently and effectively find information in big data streams; research and develop automatic (assistive) agents to detect events, extract knowledge and summarize information within big data streams; as well as methodologies to evaluate systems that process such streams I received my Ph.D on the topic of News Vertical Search using User Generated Content in 2012 and am currently part of the Information, Data and Analytics section, and within that the Information Retrieval Group. I also work with researchers and industry partners around the world to advance the IR field as co-chair of the Incident Streams emergency informatics initiative (2018-Present) at the Text Retrieval Conference (TREC).
